content.question: For <math alttext="x greater than negative 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, at any point on the graph of the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> the slope is given by <math alttext="the square root of, x cubed plus 8, end root, minus the square root of, 3 times x squared, plus 7, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></msqrt><mo>−</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>. How many points of inflection does the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have for <math alttext="negative 1 less than x, less than 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
